<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: 
Map<String, String> replacements = new HashMap<>();
replacements.put("cat", "dog");
replacements.put("dog", "fish");
replacements.put("fish", "cat");

Pattern pattern = Pattern.compile(String.join("|", replacements.keySet()));
Matcher matcher = pattern.matcher(input);
StringBuffer buffer = new StringBuffer();

while (matcher.find()) {
    matcher.appendReplacement(buffer, replacements.get(matcher.group()));
}
matcher.appendTail(buffer);

String result = buffer.toString();
<<<explanation>>>: This code creates a map of replacements, then compiles a pattern that matches any of the keys in the map. It then uses a Matcher to find each occurrence of the pattern in the input string. For each match, it appends the replacement value to a StringBuffer. Finally, it appends the remainder of the input string after the last match, and converts the StringBuffer to a string to get the result.
